name: Pathologic N Corpus Adenosarcoma/Sarcoma
title: Pathologic N
notes:
**Note 1:** When both the Federation Internationale de Gynecologie et d'Obstetrique (FIGO) stage and extension information on the primary tumor are available, use the extension information to assign the T in preference to a statement of FIGO stage - see Registrar notes.
* If the only information is (pathologic) FIGO III [NOS] or IIIC, assign the appropriate stage and leave pathologic T, N, and M blank. If the only information is FIGO stage IVB, leave T and N blank and see M

**Note 2:** Histological examination of a pelvic lymphadenectomy specimen will ordinarily include 6 or more lymph nodes. If the lymph nodes are negative, but the number ordinarily examined is not met, classify as pN0. (FIGO classifies such cases as pNX). (1)

**Note 3:**  Code only regional nodes and nodes, NOS, in this field.  Distant nodes are coded in M (distant metastasis).

**Note 4:**  Regional nodes include bilateral and contralateral involvement of named nodes.

**Note 5:**  If the clinician says "adnexa palpated" but does not mention lymph nodes, assume lymph nodes are not involved.

**Regional lymph nodes**

    Aortic, NOS
        Lateral (lumbar)
        Para-aortic
        Periaortic
    Iliac, NOS
        Common
        External
        Internal (hypogastric)
            Obturator
    Paracervical
    Parametrial
    Pelvic, NOS
    Sacral, NOS
        Lateral (laterosacral)
        Middle (promontorial) (Gerota's node)
        Presacral
        Uterosacral

    Pelvic lymph nodes, NOS

    FIGO Stage IIIC (pelvic or para-aortic lymph nodes)
    FIGO Stage IIIC1 (pelvic lymph nodes)
    FIGO Stage IIIC2 (para-aortic lymph nodes WITH or WITHOUT pelvic lymph nodes)
footnotes: (1) International Union Against Cancer (UICC) *TNM Classification of Malignant Tumors,* 7th ed., Sobin, LH, Gospodarowicz, M, Wittekind, CH, eds. New York: Wiley, 2009, pg., 215
rows: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed

    Physician unable to assess N
    Surgical resection primary tumor, no regional lymph nodes removed OR
    Involvement of regional lymph nodes not documented
Physician assign pNX, no other information available to determine N
Only information available is FIGO Stage I (all subcategories), II (all subcategories), IIIA, or IIIB

Regional lymph nodes, NOS
Lymph nodes, NOS

Stated as N1
Clinically: No regional lymph node metastasis
Use only for TNM defined pTis cases where there is a resection of the primary and the nodes are not evaluated pathologically

In situ case but no pTis is defined by TNM
Death certificate only (DCO) case

Only information available is FIGO Stage III [NOS], IIIC, or IVB

Pathologic classification not met
No surgical resection of primary tumor AND
There isn't a positive biopsy of a structure in the highest T category and highest N category
Evidence of metastatic disease (pM1), no other workup
